text: Hi everyone, is there a way to overcome Tracking API/HubSpot analytics on Adblockers?
Why? If a person uses an Adblocker, there might be a reason for it :slightly_smiling_face:

Because we have an iframe app and embedded it into a HubSpot page using modules. And we want to track the page and the app by cross domain linking. On the app, weâ€™re also planning to send custom events.

Yeah, I agree with you. I also use an Adblocker and experience the tracking script block.
Spot on sir, thank you again.

In the CMS while in the editor, if I upload an image, then select it and it gets on the page, but if I then want to replace that image wth a new version of the image, the image itself never get's updated in the *editor*
how can we clear that cache?
Hey Everyone, is it possible to create a blog post using the HubSpot-php library? Haven't found any documentation on that. Cheers.
